page.title: 16INDUSTRY IN GOXHILL.
page.content: Apart from the small amount of industry based at Goxhill Airfield there are only three other sites of industry in the area. Abbey Windows specialise in double glazing and glass products. Their site next to the railway station has expanded with a large workforce in recent years. Barrick's Transport is on the southern side of the village. About 170 men are employed driving articulated lorries, tankers and tipper lorries. Barrick's operate nationally and are also one of the village coal merchants. Thompson Industries is a small business which produces specialised coach-building for commercial vehicles. Each winter a fairground "Galloping Horses" roundabout and Gavioli organ is refurbished and stored on the premises.
